name: FALL. - Demo!
description:
Hey! Thanks for checking this out.

In FALL, you need to navigate your small little cube-shaped body through obstacles without being sent tumbling off of a platform. The catch is, you can't slow down, and you're only getting faster. The obstacles get more and more complex, so with quick reflexes and a little bit of luck, you just might not FALL. Not sold on it? Me neither. It's fun though, I promise.

This is a demo/proof-of-concept of an idea I actually came up with 3 years ago, when I started learning game development. I actually made this game back in 2017-18, as a beginner, and what came out was an awful, buggy mess.

3 years later, I still like the idea, so I decided to measure how my skills had improved by re-making it and seeing how it turned out. This is a demo, so it's really, really short, but I'm putting it out there as a proof of concept. I'm going to keep working on it, but if I get some sort of positive feedback, I might try making this into a full game and releasing it.

If anyone's interested in actually seeing the original game from 2017 and roasting me for it, let me know in the comments :)

                                                                                                                                        -Onion

CURRENTLY INCLUDES:

- 10 levels

- Not much else

Roadmap(?):

- Post-Processing/Optimisation (Complete!)

- New worlds (visual styles and environments)

- 3+ new obstacle types

- (Possibly) An endless mode
